page.title: 05Steeple Claydon - Post War
page.content: The{post war years}between 1945 and 1960 brought a number of council and private houses.In all 125 houses were built,50% of these being semi-detached,35% being terraced and only 20% detached houses.However 17 bungalows were built mainly "infilling" between existing dwellings,whereas the majority of houses were built on{small housing {estates.}2 more shops were built bringing the total to 7 the number trading today. The building "boom" existed between 1960 and 1984.The general pattern has been the establishment of{cheaper {starter homes}for young families,followed by larger houses.Of 290 dwellings built,154 were smaller terraced houses,with 64 detached,38 semi-detached and 34 bungalows.More building is planned.
